did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection includes 22 letters written by J. Harry McBroom, possibly from Abingdon, Virginia, to Thyrza Fugate detailing campus life in 1904-1905.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from J. Henry McBroom Papers must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: J. Harry McBroom Papers, Ms1974-016, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: J. Harry McBroom Papers were acquired by the Special Collections prior to 1974.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the J. Harry McBroom Papers was completed prior to 2010. Additional description was completed in January 2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: J. Harry McBroom attended VPI from 1904-1905. It is unclear if he graduate and he is not listed in the graduating classes of 1906, 1907, 1908, or 1909. He was from Abingdon, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes 22 letters written by McBroom between October 6,1904-August 14,1905, to Thyrza Fugate detailing campus life. McBroom was a sophomore during 1904-1905. The collection also contains three pieces of sheet music: "Sing Me A Song of the South," "The Blue and The Gray," and "Gen. Robert E. Lee's Quick March."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by material type. Correspondence is in chronological order.
